event.title: became the seat of Hamilton County in 1840

data.event: It was later named Harrison after President William Henry Harrison and became the seat of Hamilton County in 1840.
The first post office was opened on June 16, 1841.

event.title: 1870 the Hamilton County Courthouse was moved

data.event: In 1870 the Hamilton County Courthouse was moved from Harrison to Chattanooga.
